summary: This bill, the Healthy Meals Help Kids Learn Act of 2025, aims to amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act and the Child Nutrition Act of 1966. It proposes increasing reimbursement rates for school meals. Specifically, it mandates an additional 45 cents per school lunch and an extra 28 cents for free, reduced-price, and other breakfasts served in school food authorities, starting November 1, 2025. These amounts will be adjusted annually beginning July 1, 2026.
